website_summaries.verdict: Though you pay for the convenience, the Nikon AF-S DX VR 18-200mm f3.5-5.6 G IF ED covers a range that would normally take two lenses, yet remains compact with a solid build.
pros: Vibration Reduction for better handheld photos, especially at telephoto

customer_reviews.title: never a moments regret
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this lens for the better part of a year now and LOVE IT. no more switching lenses on the fly, super crisp and relatively fast. Have been using this with my nikon d300s and have yet to regret not getting the 18-300 instead. I think the size and weight of the lens isn't bad. I would purchase again in a heartbeat and have recommended to family and friends they invest in one that fits them as well. Thank you Nikkor
customer_reviews.author: nezo311

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Nikon 18-whatever zooms around.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second copy of this lens and it's an exceptional lens. If you need one lens to carry with you all day--this is the one and I say that not just based off of the zoom coverage within this one lens, but because of the exceptional images that this lens produces. It produces incredibly sharp images at nearly every focal length and aperture. Nearly any lens correction that needs to be done can be done via Photoshop if you shoot in RAW/NEF when opened up on your computer. I've used this lens when I only wanted to carry one lens when covering 24 hour fitness endurance events and it has served me incredibly well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Good price for good condition.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with condition of this good used lens as described at a good price. I've been using the same type of lens on a Nikon D300 with excellent results for over 11 years before sending it in for repairs to Nikon because of agear noise. It's been restored to like new. This second 18-200mm zoom AF-S 1:3.5-5.6 G ED DX lens is going to be used on another D300. I have no hesitation in recommending this lens from the supplier who sent it to me through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: P. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Buy this lens and the Nikon body You'll never regret it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect "NORMAL" LENS. Buy the Nikon body and this instead of the kit lens. Works as sort of a "macro" lens for insects and flowers too.... you won't have to get close for GREAT photos !! Buy this ...You'll never be sorry !
customer_reviews.author: DrBob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome All Purpose Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is the second copy, still have the original, for use on our second Nikon D200. This is absolutely the flexible use champion of all lenses on the market. It is not perfect in any task but it is very good in everything you do. For a general purpose, vacation lens, you absolutely cannot go wrong with this lens. Highly recommended for good build quality, good performance, great pictures, compact size and acceptable weight, and excellent Vibration Reduction (VR) feature. It focuses fast and accurately, it is very sharp across the entire focal range, and you can get great low light or telephoto shots due to it's VR. It is reasonably priced for the overall benefits of this incomparable lens.
customer_reviews.author: Trader One

customer_reviews.title: This lens is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I take wedding photos for a living, and am always looking for ways of obtaining better images. I recently upgraded from the Nikon 24-85 zoom to the Nikon 18-200 VR lens. I had hopes that it would allow me to shoot at lower shutter speeds, in the dim lighting situations of Churches and receptions. I am amazed at how well this lens increases the overall number of good images. I recommend this product highly to anyone who wants to increase their zoom range and obtain better images in low light. If you use the Fuji S3 camera, as I do, be aware that there is an incompatibility with this lens that can be corrected by Fuji at no cost.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Peterse

customer_reviews.title: The only lens I use
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy multi-purpose lens with a quiet motor and not too huge. Focus is a little soft at the 200mm mark but not so bad that sharpness can't be improved in post-processing. VR is worth the money - it not only steadies camera shake but also allows the user to shoot with a hand-held camera at ridiculously slow shutter speeds in good light. I take a lot of photographs outdoors and love the flexibility of being able to go from a wide angle shot to a closeup of an insect or flower without having to change lenses. My camera sensor stays cleaner longer thanks to that!
customer_reviews.author: Vivian SB

customer_reviews.title: Lens will creep
customer_reviews.text: Price was too good to pass up but this heavy zoom lens suffers the dreaded lens creep that a lot of long zooms have. Not a deal breaker and it is fixable by using a 1/16" X 2 1/2" O ring.
customer_reviews.author: D. Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-200mm Review
customer_reviews.text: This is a great everyday use lens. I find myself using this lens about 90% of the time. The other 10% is split between a 17-35mm Nikkor and a 70-300mm Nikkor. At parties or gatherings, you'll find this lens extremely useful because it will allow you to capture both wide angle (group shots) as well as zoom in close to the action. With the 17-35mm, I wasn't able to have this flexibility in that situation. The VR works as advertised and works extremely well. For the common consumer who just wants to capture lifes events, this is the lens to get.
customer_reviews.author: J. Orate

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Lens
customer_reviews.text: I love the product and It came right on time! Thanks! I'll be back to get more!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Incompatibility with Polarizing Filter
customer_reviews.text: Love the full range of zoom with my Nikon D50. It's roughly the same length as the 18-55 that came with the camera, and about 1/2 to 3/4" larger in diameter. Certainly heavier too. About the same weight and size as my 12-14 wide angle lens. Only negative is that pictures gets blurry (out of focus) at full zoom close to 200mm when I use a Merkury lense filter. Yes, I'm using a tripod and remote release, so it's not me shaking. Maybe this is normal? No problems with no-filter, and with the UV filter - just the polarizer filter.
customer_reviews.author: Schluterville

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need for a telephoto lens
customer_reviews.text: Remarkable all around lens for every day use. I bought it for my helicopter work doing ariel landscaping Shots, but I’m now using it 80% of the time for most everything on my Nikon D300s.
customer_reviews.author: Milton Milne

customer_reviews.title: Greatest lens bargain from Nikon ever.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 18-35 zoom 3 or 4 years ago, and it was great. Several years ago I bought the 18-70, and it was also a great bargain. The 18-200 replaces the other two, and in addition is a better lens for most subjects! What do I mean by better? I mean that 8X10 prints show no flaws that are attributable to the lens. However, there is some barrel distortion at short focal lengths, so be careful of architecture. The VR feature works extrememly well, and makes up for the slow aperture at the long end at least for static subjects.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Lens!  Worth Every Penny.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing lens. It is just as everyone describes it in all these reviews. However, a note of caution when you use this as your single lens. If you are going to use it indoors WITHOUT an external flash you will create a SHADOW on your pictures. In the 18mm - 24mm range, the camera's built-in flash is too low to "look" over the end of the lens. This will create a shadow on your flashed subject. However, you can zoom in to 24mm and the issue goes away. I love only carrying one lens and the amazing VR technology allows me to take low-level light photos without a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: C. Aljilani

customer_reviews.title: I feel like being cheated because the lens will automatically loosen.
customer_reviews.text: I feel like being cheated because the lens will automatically loosen.
customer_reviews.author: shiaw,kwang-jer

customer_reviews.title: Love the zoom range
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great all purpose lens. It has better zoom that the normal 18mm-55mm that's normally sold with cameras. Way to expensive to buy anywhere in retail stores so I love that i bought this for less than $300. Just wish the seller would have told me it makes this weird noise when zooming in during "live preview" mode. Other than that its a good lens.
customer_reviews.author: Roxana

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 4 lenses with this lens. Really good reach, definitely gets out there. Autofocus can be a little slow at times, but it IS an older refurbished lens.
customer_reviews.author: J-Fizzle

customer_reviews.title: Heavy lens
customer_reviews.text: If you need one lens to get everything done... this is a good choice. Not great in low light. The stabilization is much better than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W.

customer_reviews.title: Best lens ever
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best lens I have ever owned. Focus is fast and sharp as a tack and the color is superb. The VR function is the best feature. I love being able to handhold my camera at 40th to 30th of a second and still get crisp shots. It even works well for indoor wedding shots. No need for a tripod. It works great with flash as well and those moments when you want to drag the shutter. I can't say enough about this product. It is totally worth the money paid!
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Lens !!
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur photographer. I love closeups and colorful landscapes. This is one amazing Lens. Right out of the box..it proved itself ! Some of the test pictures I shot were just unimaginable without the VR. Focus is fast and the pictures came out sharp. I did not notice any creep. I have a 35-70 and a 70-300 Lens. Now all I need is this lens !! No more problems of Dust getting into the CCD. Thanks Nikon for a superb lens and thanks Amazon for the free PRIME shipping which arrived as promised !!
customer_reviews.author: Envee

customer_reviews.title: great lens
customer_reviews.text: i waited a long time before buying this lens.. im very happy i finally did. amazing zoom range. the only lens you'll ever need! (unless you're a pro. some say it has to be less sharp due to this feature but i've been into photography for a while now and i cant tell the difference. the VR actually works, so u can get sharper pictures in to so amazing lighting or while moving and make great panning shots. buy it. u wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Meni H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible lens. Easy to use, great results. The ability to zoom from 18mm all the way to 200mm makes this the only lens i need
customer_reviews.author: JeremyT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised of the quality of this used lens. It looks like brand new. I started to use immediately and completely satisfied with very smooth operation and picture quality. It is just one day try, but so far everything is all right (including the lowest price on Amazon site).
customer_reviews.author: Serguei

customer_reviews.title: Nikon's Vibration Reduction is Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: This lens coupled with any Nikon digital SLR is a great combination that has excellent potential to make three or more of your lenses obsolete. It's whisper quiet and quick autofocus is what I expect from Nikon and this is my first foray into the world of VR (vibration reduction). I was able to consistently take sharply focused shots with exposures as low as 1/20 second and nearly blur free shots at as low as 1/6 of a second exposure. Highly recommended lens -- you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Buell

customer_reviews.title: great lens
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to buy this lens because I had heard so much about the creeping issue and some other things that kinda put up a red flag but I used it on my friends D300 and loved it so I bought my own. I literally have only taken it off once and that was to put my 50mm 1.8 on. I love that this can be your only lens when you are out on a day trip or something. It pretty much covers all basis and is a great walk around lens!
customer_reviews.author: therightamt

customer_reviews.title: Great all around lens
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 2 lenses with this one, works great! focuses fast with my D50, pics are terrific, so nice to have just one lens to carry, and not have to worry about swapping lenses mid-photo taking. I've heard of 'lens drop', but have not yet had it happen to me. Only caveat...had to buy a better camera strap, the lens is heavy when dangling from your neck (esp when you're carrying a 4 and a 1.5 yr old as well :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great multipurpose beginner lens. It has loads of setting. Bought it for my daughter who is just getting into photography. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Zoom is a little loose
customer_reviews.text: When pointing straight, this lens is a fantastic zoom. It's good with focusing and is relatively quick. Nikon's VR technology is also really good. The only complaint I have is that when I point up or down the lens will start expanding or pulling back on its own based on the gravitational force. I expected to be able to set this lens to a certain barrel length and have it stay there until I changed it.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a lens that I could walk around with on vacation and always feel like I was able to get any shot. This lens does that for me. I have very few complaints - it's not 100% sharp from corner to corner all the way down the range, but it's hard to expect that from this type of lens at this price. It's super reliable, always quite sharp, fast to focus and most importantly, just gets great shots. I love it. Also, it seems that a number of issues people were having in earlier cycles - like the lens creep - have been corrected.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased this...
customer_reviews.text: I sold my nikon 18-55 kit lens and 55-200 VR to fund this lens, and I'm very glad I did. Image quality is good and it's so nice not to be changing lenses back and forth. This sucker is pretty heavy, so keep that in mind. The updated VR is MUCH better than on my 55-200. Very happy with my purchase. FYI, mine is a factory demo I purchased from Cameta Camera. I highly recommend that company.
customer_reviews.author: James S. Yelverton

customer_reviews.title: Is a good lens, not so much in a low light
customer_reviews.text: Is a good lens, not so much in a low light, real good in good for out side pictures, but also I have a a Nikon D3100 , the lense is little slow for me over all a good lens Will up grade to a 2.8. next year
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a used product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used. It works good except that the lens falls all the way out if it is turned upside down. So, if I'm carrying it on the cord around my neck, the lens falls out and extends to the longest length. Other than that, it works great. Nice to have a lens that is 18-200.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and was exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Bought it USED from Amazon. Worked great and was exactly as described. I used it as an all in one for traveling. It was exactly what I was looking for since the D3300 comes with a standard 18-50mm lens, which is really just okay for everyday things.
customer_reviews.author: WonderAna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality and photos
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this for my birthday and I use it on my D40. As I get more serious about photography it's great to know I've got a serious piece of glass to last me for years to come! The lens is typical Nikon high quality and construction. At this point this lens does everything I need. This lens is worth the money!! I purchased this lens from Beach Camera and it got here FAST!
customer_reviews.author: twesterh

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this lens wanting something with a larger range, as I couldn't afford to buy 2-3 decent lenses for different ranges, and also wanting the ease of not having to change lenses all the time and potentially be missing pics. As a semi-professional photographer, I love the way it reacts, feels, and responds. Controls are easy to switch around during shooting and unless you are a super telephoto/wide angle freak this lens has a very large range. Love it on my new Nikon D90 and within 3 short photo shoots I am more than pleased and perfectly comfortable with it. Definetely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: T Rex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens, you can find lots of information about it if you want to read. but remember it is HEAVY. first used it with a Nikon D40x the lens is way too heavy for it, adding a battery grip helps balance the weight. now I use it with a Nikon D90 and much better "weight wise"
customer_reviews.author: Albeniz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Lens for zooming in on your shot! I use it for my daughter's soccer games.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M

customer_reviews.title: Best Nikon Lens I've Used
customer_reviews.text: From film days, my favorite Nikon lens was the 24-120 zoom, but the 18-200 beats it. Excellent contrast, great clarity and the vibration-reduction is terrific - I get about 80% of the clarity of a tripod shot with hand-held VR. It's a lot of money, but I'm going to sell a bunch of other Nikon lenses that I don't need any more to pay the Visa bill.
customer_reviews.author: DPVan

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens, but you need to make sure you ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice lens, but you need to make sure you have a steady hand (like an photographer should) because it can totally mess up your picture if you don't, but so far I am happy with it
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: I like the convenience...
customer_reviews.text: I like the convenience of this lens, but I'm a little bit disappointed in it. The zoom is somehow stiff and loose at the same time, and feels "plasticky". I really like an out of focus background, and with this lens it's not very pleasing. I much prefer my 70-300 VR there. On the other hand, it's sharp, and focuses fast. And soooo very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Andale

customer_reviews.title: Probably a great lens, that I have been searching for but ...
customer_reviews.text: Probably a great lens, that I have been searching for but this was a grey market lens without the Nikon 5 year warranty. This did not come with the Nikon official certificate that would be included with a official lens. The warranty that they were providing was for a repair service center in Brooklyn and was only for a year. Buyer beware. Mine is on its way back to the seller today thanks to Amazon's great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Reader72

customer_reviews.title: Best travel lens.
customer_reviews.text: Best travel lens by far! a must have for travel. Great lens length and sharpness. Dont go Sigma or Tamahron because you'll all ways be wondering, what if i got the Nikon?
customer_reviews.author: sailorcolin

customer_reviews.title: Very good DX lens
customer_reviews.text: Very good DX lens. Not expensive but covers a wide range for one lens. Recommended for DX Nikon users. Fast enough for all photography with a good camera body behind it.
customer_reviews.author: SimmSamm

customer_reviews.title: Best Lens of it's kind - regardless of brand
customer_reviews.text: I have taken well over 1,000 images with this lens on a D40 body and I can tell you that it's great! The telephoto length is essentially unrivaled. Except for a few cases (extreme wide angle, fisheye, or sports/extreme telephoto) you won't need any other lens. I love it's versatility. Never before have I been able take so many photos in lower light situations and have them show up crisp. This lens isn't cheap, but really, it's a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lens very sharp, some distortion but not bad for a lens in this range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-200mm lens
customer_reviews.text: Although this is lens makes the camera a little heavy, I am very happy to have the one lens of the 18-200mm. I find with the 18-55 and the 55-200 lens, I am often changing lenses and it is an extra item to carry when I am traveling. I have been very pleased with the quality of the pictures and it is very easy to use. The VR feature almost eliminates the blur at the 200 mm setting.
customer_reviews.author: Wunderlust

customer_reviews.title: Loving this lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens to replace two others and it's doing a fine job of it. Has a huge zoom range without distortion. Love not having to swap lenses all the time. Bought this lens based on reviews in dpreview.com and kenrockwell.com.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: it works great and is a very sharp lens
customer_reviews.text: Lens has lens creep if pointed down and you walk around with it, and the autofocus is a little loud, but those were issues the lens had from its design, it works great and is a very sharp lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy P.

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: This is my lens number 1 now! It is very versatile and now I take my D200 to everywhere. I've read some negative opinions here and I was doubting, "But..." I thought "I had more than four SLR Nikons (just one Digital) and those guys really do well...". So, I bought and I am happy with this product, I do recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: A. MELLO

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of glass
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this lens. It covers a huge zoom range and permits taking more pictures from a stationary position without having to move in closer or get further back. This easily replaces my 28-200 lens and my 24-120 Nikkor lens both of which are not as contrasty or as sharp.
customer_reviews.author: KAITECH

customer_reviews.title: Good for Macros
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lens, it does great macros. The VR seems to work well. My only complaint is that it zooms out on its own if I carry my camera hanging down, so I have to carry my camera a different way with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great one Lens does All
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the full range in one lens. I'm more or less a dilettante when it comes to photography but it more than serves my needs. Yes, it's very expensive, but now, I can get by with just one lens. It performs quite well over the whole range. Be aware that it is quite heavy compared to the basic lenses. Overall, I'm happy I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Hank M

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: Lens is very versatile. You can have it auto focus or you can do it yourself. It takes nice pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Brennan

customer_reviews.title: review if partnered with d40
customer_reviews.text: it`s pretty closed to 5 stars but not perfect because it is too heavy for d40, probably perfect for other bigger nikkons which i dont have. makes it a good everday lens...very flexible but again...heavy for my d40 and seems a poor balance.. pictures come out great!!!
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: One of the greatest lenses I ever bought. Works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Manny Correira

customer_reviews.title: Excellent walking around lens
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens with the Nikon D80 camera body and am finding it to be a very functional lens. I am not a pro and cannot compare it in sharpness to any prime lens, however for a fairly generous zoom 10+ times, and with its vibration reduction, it is a very nice lens.
customer_reviews.author: RJN

customer_reviews.title: Not tested
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tested it long term so I will need to revisit my review. I am really picky about my lenses. But so far it is a great every day lens. I don't like to travel with my big bulky lenses and can't afford the 18-300-yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic versatile lens
customer_reviews.text: Everyone has already said it, but this is a great lens. I've got a D40 and wanted to have both a wide angle and a zoom. Saw this on a D300 at the camera store and fell in love. It's got great range and feels very solid. Now I don't need to swap lenses anymore. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Very Good lens replacing my 18-135mm kit lens
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Yes, the lens does "creep" but overall does the job. I did notice some vignetting when fully zoomed at 135mm (which is expected) but the VR (vibration reduction) really works for low-lighting environments when I need it to since my hands are not as steady at times. Rent this lense at your local camera store (if it's in stock at all) and test it out for yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Dare 2 Live

customer_reviews.title: Best LENS?
customer_reviews.text: This is my first lens, so it's hard to compare it's performance with anything else. But it is a really versatile lens that takes very nice pictures. There are better lens for specific items, i.e. speed, macro, zoom, but this is a good as it gets for having everything in one lens. I recommend it, unless you have problems carring a heavier camera
customer_reviews.author: K. Poon

customer_reviews.title: I often have to refocus or take over manually to get a good picture. The zoom range is great though
customer_reviews.text: Sharp enough, but very noisy and slow to focus. I often have to refocus or take over manually to get a good picture. The zoom range is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: This is the only lens you'll need - 95% of the time
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey for my Nikon D40, but worth every penny. The VR makes a huge difference, and the one-lens convenience is definitely worth the money. Indoor performance is also very good. Bought this before the price increase and very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Falstaff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens, super clear glass, does everything I want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen V. Le

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really fell in love with this lens. It is a very good lens. Takes great pics.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Certainly a good price for a good result. You can buy more expensive lenses but this one provides good value for money. Can see detail across the other side of the street that is not visable to the naked eye through the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie Gal

customer_reviews.title: An excellent lens for all around use.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this lens for several months in a large variety of photographic applications and I am quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the very best lenses ever made. The only lens you ever need for an everyday photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Quixle

customer_reviews.title: Great Experiecne
customer_reviews.text: Seller had great communication. The lens was in great shape, I haven't played with the VR enough to notice a difference (I can still take some majestic blurry photos with VR on) though it did seem to help a little bit when I was shooting the blood moon.overall a great lens. Fits on the D80 body nicely
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-200mm
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens within the allotted time frame and was so excited to get it! I have been enjoying shooting photos with it and it has been working really well!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-200mm VR Zoom Lens
customer_reviews.text: Product is the best match for your Nikon SLR. I have used other popular after market lens brands but always come back to the O.E.M. branded lenses.The quality is such that your pictures will pop off the prints or your computer screen. Color shift is minimal and the 200mm focal length will let more light in. Buying on Amazon was the best choice since there was an increase in pricing of Nikon products in the U.S.
customer_reviews.author: BaltoSid

customer_reviews.title: Great item to start
customer_reviews.text: My son is learning from this versatile, proven Nikon lens. He's experiencing creep when using close-up lens is attached. When pointed downward there's creeping and he finds parking the zoom back to 18mm to lock annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Odnalro

customer_reviews.title: Does it all!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a top quality lens, which lives up to what one would expect from Nikon. I am an amateur and this is more than what I will ever need!
customer_reviews.author: tbkimbrel

customer_reviews.title: The best Nikon lens
customer_reviews.text: Sorry for the short review but I have had this lens for 3 years and it is hands down the best investment I have made for my camera. you will need no other lens. Buy it NOW!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Go Falcons

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Instead of buying a 55-200 VR and switching with the 18-55, I got this one, just for practical reasons. Is not very fast, so it can't do miracles if you have poor lighting, but I took some great outdoor daytime pictures. The VR works great, makes a big difference. It's a bit heavy and cumbersome, but beats hands down carrying two lenses and switching them.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Zamberlan

customer_reviews.title: superb; 11: 1 ratio, very sharp and ...
customer_reviews.text: superb; 11:1 ratio, very sharp and is my primary lens.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I like this product very well, the sailer good too! ! ! Very thanks Very well for my family and house!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great for vacations
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a recent vacation where I wanted to carry only one lens and not have to be changing lenses. Worked just as advetised - wide zoom range and vibration reduction.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Best work horse!
customer_reviews.text: If you were to buy one lens, this is it! It does everything and pictures come out very sharp. Lens is not too heavy nor bulky and the price is reasonable for what it does. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: meowface

customer_reviews.title: Ready for action anytime anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner in photography, I was a little hesitate to use 18-200mm lens due to its price and heavyness. However, after attached with this Nikon lens, I was hardly put it off from my D5000. It is fit to my hands and the result is surely above my expectations. I really have a good time with this lens. Thank you Nikon, Thank you Amazon. Regards, antonius
customer_reviews.author: antonius

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It does not zoom in near as good as I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the perfect lens
customer_reviews.text: I liked so much I bought one for my daughter too. It is much better than having 2 lenses you have to switch back and forth to.
customer_reviews.author: Garry D. Kepley

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: WOW, describes this lens the best. It is compact and quite light compared to other 200mm lenses. For the ammateur photographer... this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lens and so versatile, you can leave the bag behind.
customer_reviews.author: Out Of Bounds

customer_reviews.title: The lens was as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It works and its a great lens. Odd thing, the front element unscrewed and fell out when I was first playing with it. No harm done, I screwed it back in and it worked flawlessly. Also the front cap is not the original one but still does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Blaise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, versatile lens for almost any use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this lens as my primary with my D50 for almost four months now, and it has rarely let me down. You can't beat Nikkor glass and the range has allowed be to use one lens instead of switching between two. Mostly use it for indoor family shots, with some outdoor / sporting events as well. My only complaint is the location of the focus ring, but that's pretty picky. Overall I highly recommend this lens!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Post

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. This is the only lens I need on my camera now. No more swapping. The photos are brilliant, even in low light conditions. The VR works amazing. This lens has made a big difference in the quality and the number of pictures I am taking. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Chandrashekar R. Gaajula

customer_reviews.title: Superior Lens
customer_reviews.text: This was worth the wait and I did indeed wait due to the backorder situation with Nikon. I had a Sigma DC 18-200 which worked perfectly fine, but the VR makes all the difference in the world hand holding at slow speeds. Nikon advertises you can shoot up to 1/15 of a second. I was able to even shoot up to 1/13 without any blur. This is well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but a plesure
customer_reviews.text: I'm an occasional photographer (Nikon D70). Not too many shots but varying from my family Christmas party (in the dark) to kids skiing fast in the Alps (in the sun and in the snow). My impression is that it is the lens as the lens should be. For people like me it is a dream come true. Anything "simpler" than this lens is just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Alexey Miroshnikov

customer_reviews.title: Great all around all in one lens...
customer_reviews.text: For serious amateur photographers using Nikon who are interested in carrying one lens for most shooting, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Nibrocla

customer_reviews.title: I really like this lens a lot....
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I'd rather it be is a faster lens, and those cost a lot more money, but otherwise, this is an excellent lens, for DX format cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Alonzi

customer_reviews.title: Best in Line - Nikkor does it again
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, i could go into the details here but without a doubt this is the the best lens I have had. Its kinda all in one lens, covering my wide angle and zoom spectrums. VR, ED glass, focus meter, got it all. Great aperture band too, given its range.
customer_reviews.author: Dilip Ramachandran

customer_reviews.title: A great choice
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect deal. Clear description and a shipment with no problems. Communication was not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio M. Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to come by. They can't be made fast enough! Excellent product. Works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: E. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens it's amazing!!! I love the auto/ manual option for focus! Love. love. love this lens can't get enough of it :)
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: easy lens to use, but has a lot to be desired
customer_reviews.text: this was an okay beginner's lens for my nikon D90. being able to go from 18 to 200mm did give me some flexibility and convenience. however, the quality is quite lacking. the lens isn't sharp at all, it's very difficult to gain any bokeh and the lens isn't light. personally, once i bought a 35mm f1.8, i almost never took that lens off.
customer_reviews.author: Philma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used to be a great walk-able lens back than, I sold this after moving to D300.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: One kit lens
customer_reviews.text: I am not a pro but an avid amateur. I was getting tired of carrying a bagful of lenses especially when out on a holiday. With this lens I doubt if I will be using my other lenses half as often. This is a beautiful lens with super image quality and zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Vikas Kala

customer_reviews.title: I am TOTALLY pleased with this lens
customer_reviews.text: I am TOTALLY pleased with this lens! While I rarely switched out my 18-105mm lens, there were still times where the wrong lens was on my camera at a critical time. No longer! From wide angle landscape panoramas to the quick shot of a bird landing in a tree, this lens does it all! I had expected to see some loss of sharpness with the larger range zoom lens, but that has not been the case either! This lens is sharp! Am I pleased? You betcha!!! Frank Leonard, Frank Leonard Photography.
customer_reviews.author: F. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: WOW...What a lens!
customer_reviews.text: This Nikon lens does it all! What a great walk-a-round lens that could easily stay on my camera always!!! I will most likely use it for just that once I get my new Nikon D90.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Ricci Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Travel Lens
customer_reviews.text: Whether you are hiking, traveling or just out for collecting images with just one "do all lens", this is the ticket. Sharp images ! Very pleased with this purchase ! Bob Huestis
customer_reviews.author: Carmel A. Huestis

product_meta.title: Nikon G ED-IF AF-S DX VR 2159 18-200mm f/3.5-5.6 Zoom Nikkor Lens for Nikon F White Box(Bulk Packaging) (New)
product_meta.description: This versatile, 11x zoom with VR image stabilization, is designed exclusively for use with Nikon’s DX-format, and makes for a perfect one-lens solution.
feature_bullets: Offers broad 18 to 200 millimeter focal range for use in a variety of situations, equivalent to a 27 to 300 lens in 35 millimeter format
Vibration Reduction, enables handheld shooting at up to 4 shutter speeds slower than would otherwise be possible, assuring dramatically sharper still images and video capture
Nikon Super Integrated Coating (SIC) offers superb color reproduction while minimizing ghosting and flare
Enables focusing from as close as 50 centimeter (20 inches) from the subject through its entire focal range; Flower shaped lens hood (HB-35) provides greatly reduced stray light
Employs a 7 blade rounded diaphragm opening that achieves a natural blur for out of focus elements
High-ratio, 11x zoom lens and 18-200mm focal range
VR Vibration Reduction technology provides a four-steps-faster shutter speed
Lens incorporates two ED glass and three aspheric lens elements
Delivers high-resolution and contrast, outstanding image quality, and fantastic photographic versatility
AF-S Silent Wave Motor provides fast quiet autofocusing, and M/A mode makes it easy to switch from auto to manual focus

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars541 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
